content: slip­stitch stash hat repeat rounds 1 4 once then knit rounds 1 and 2 once more if you want to make this hat even warmer do an additional 20 rounds of this garter patter to fold up the brim over the ears this will use more yarn by renee rico body the slip-stitch pattern is a six-round pattern with even number of stitches round 1 knit with color a round 2 with color b * k1 slip 1 with yarn in back * for the whole round round 3 with b * p1 slip 1 with yarn in back * for the whole round round 4 knit with color c round 5 with color d * slip 1 with yarn in back k1 * for the whole round round 6 with d * slip 1 with yarn in back p1 * for the whole round repeat 1 6 rounds switching in colors as you feel like it if you only have enough yarn for one round use it for either round 2 or 5 since that creates the purl bump and gives a pop to the round this hat is colorful and toasty warm especially when knit in round until the hat measures 6 7 8 inches from made with animal fiber yarn use up your stash leftovers the beginning ending with either round 3 or round 6 for a colorful topper or fewer colors for a more coordinated appeal slowly variegated yarns are also a crown terrific option switch colors in and out as you wish to make a bulls- eye at the top of the hat it is easier to do this on the materials odd-numbered rounds which are plain knit rounds about 150-200 yards of worsted-weight and aran weight round 1 knit yarns round 2 *k8 k2tog * repeat to end of round 16 in 40 cm circular needle in size 7 4 5 mm or size round 3 and following odd numbered rounds knit needed to get gauge round 4 *k7 k2tog * repeat to end of round darning needle round 6 *k6 k2tog * repeat to end of round stitch marker round 8 *k5 k2tog * repeat to end of round round 10 *k4 k2tog * repeat to end of round gauge round 12 *k3 k2tog * repeat to end of round garter stitch 4 5 stitches = 1 inch after this round there are no more plain knit rounds slip-stitch pattern 4 to 4 5 stitches per inch round 13 *k2 k2tog * repeat to end of round stockinette stitch 5 stitches = 1 inch round 14 *k1 k2tog * repeat to end of round round 15 *k2tog * repeat to end of round knit 0 1 0 sizes 18 inches
